title: Saarinen Dining Table, Round
description:
Architect Eero Saarinen was a genius at creating expressive sculptural forms. From his TWA Terminal (now the TWA Hotel) at New York’s JFK Airport to the Gateway Arch in St. Louis to his Pedestal Table (1956), there’s a magic in everything he created. The Saarinen Dining Table, as he explained in a 1956 Time magazine cover story, was designed to “clear up the slum of legs in the U.S. home.” Later that year, he completed the Pedestal Table, which stands on a gracefully shaped cast-aluminum base. This is the authentic Pedestal Table by Knoll. It’s stamped with the KnollStudio logo and Eero Saarinen’s signature. Tabletop made in Italy or U.S.A., depending on material.
  • This is an authentic Knoll Saarinen Table.
  • Choice of marble, granite, quartz, wood veneer, or laminate top.
  • Sculptural pedestal base inspired by a drop of liquid offers more legroom.
Eco-Friendly Description: Certified Intertek Clean Air GOLD. Products certified Intertek Clean Air GOLD are certified for low-VOC emissions and conform to ANSI/ BIFMA e3 standard credits 7.6.1, 7.6.2 and/or credit 7.6.3, which includes California Department of Public Health (CDPH) Standard Method v1.2 01350 (2017), as well as conformance to low-emitting materials for WELL and LEED.
Brand
Knoll®
Collection
Saarinen Dining Table Collection
General Dimensions
  • 28¼" H 42¼" DIA

title: OE1 Table
description:
When Kim Colin and Sam Hecht created products for Yamaha, Issey Miyake, Herman Miller, Muji, and many other companies, they approached each project as a means of simplifying people’s lives in an inspirational way. An essential modern desk, the OE1 Table (2020) embodies that philosophy, with a minimalist aesthetic and flexible functionality that bring quietude and utility to the home or office. It’s designed to work individually, in multiples, and with what you already have.
  • Teardrop legs can be positioned in two ways.
  • Turn legs one way for a rounded corner, another way for a crisp edge.
  • A simple, refined design that makes a refreshing statement in a home office or workplace.
Brand
Herman Miller
Collection
OE1 Collection
General Dimensions
  • 28½" H 72" W 30" D
Product Weight
85 lbs
Assembly
Requires Assembly
Warranty
12-year warranty
Terms and conditions apply. Learn more

title: Eames Table
description:
The versatile Eames Table (1964) is a durable, simple, sleek solution for residential and commercial settings. It features a sturdy streamlined base with plenty of legroom and leveling floor glides for uneven surfaces. Depending on selected options, the table is constructed of varying percentages of recycled and recyclable materials. This is an authentic Eames Table by Herman Miller. Greenguard Certified. Simple assembly required.
  • Legendary husband-and-wife design team.
  • A range of size, base, and top options.
  • Constructed of recycled and recyclable materials.
Brand
Herman Miller
General Dimensions
  • 28½" H 30" W 30" D 30" DIA

50.25 lbs

title: Nelson X-Leg Table
description:
George Nelson did his work at home and in his office (and probably every place in between), and his lack of distinction between those spaces shows in the multifunctional furniture he designed – especially the universal X-Leg Table (1950). Accommodating by design, this table pairs well with everything from dining chairs to task chairs. This is the authentic Nelson X-Leg Table produced by Herman Miller, Inc. Nelson is a trademark of Herman Miller.
  • Large tabletop for ample workspace.
  • Sturdy tubular steel legs for great support.
  • Pairs with task and dining chairs.
  • This is not a folding table.

Herman Miller

title: Doubleframe Table
description:
After being schooled in industrial design and engineering at the Royal College of Art and Imperial College in London, Michael Anastassiades founded his studio in 1994. His pieces, which fall somewhere in between industrial and sculptural, can be found in hotels, restaurants, and shops worldwide, including the SoHo House New York, the Grand Hôtel Stockholm, and Sergio Rossi boutiques. Giving a nod to the classic Parsons table, Anastassiades focused on materials, craftsmanship, and timelessness when creating his sleek Doubleframe Table (2018). “I wanted a table that would be as relevant to our lives now as it will be in the future, as it could have been in the past,” he says. “The language of it is so distilled.” Available with a wood veneer or marble top set in a solid wood base, it has a twofold character, hence its name. Small size seats 6–8 people, large size 8–10. Made in Canada.
  • Timeless dining table with solid oak or walnut frame.
  • Available with a recessed wood veneer or marble top.
  • Small size seats 6–8, large 8–10.
Brand
Herman Miller
General Dimensions
  • 29" H 70" W 36" D
Assembly
Requires Assembly
Warranty
5-year warranty

title: Copenhague 20 Dining Table 2.0
description:
In collaboration with HAY, brothers Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec designed the Copenhague 20 Dining Table (2013) as part of a furniture series created for the University of Copenhagen. The school’s requirements included functionality, durability, ease of cleaning, and a welcoming expression. The designers responded with the CPH 20, topped with laminate, oak veneer, or nanotech linoleum featuring a soft-touch ultra-matte finish that’s resistant to smudges and easy to clean. Made in Denmark.
  • Designed by Ronan and Erwan Bouroullec for the University of Copenhagen.
  • Small-space-friendly table in two sizes and a range of easy-to-clean surfaces.
  • Features tripod frame with angled, solid wood legs.
  • Made in Denmark.
Brand
HAY
Collection
Copenhague Collection
General Dimensions
  • 29¼" H 35¼" DIA
Product Weight
38 lbs
Assembly
Requires Assembly
Warranty
5-Year Warranty
Terms and conditions apply. Learn more

title: Utzon Dining Table
description:
Wild wood takes pride of place in the remarkable Utzon Dining Table (2016). Its expansive surface is made entirely from solid oak or walnut and infused with subtle details. Corner table legs feature an elegant indented edge that further showcases the wood’s depth. An innovative “sandwich” construction technique prevents warping, while a concealed steel cable ensures the table’s stability over time. Designed by Jeppe Utzon, grandson of Sydney Opera House architect Jørn Utzon, the table combines artistic craftsmanship with structural integrity, creating a timeless gathering place for meals and conversation. Made in the Czech Republic.
  • Expansive table made entirely from solid oak or walnut.
  • Combines artistic craftsmanship with structural integrity.
  • Choose from three sizes: 73" seats 6–8, 95" seats 8–10, 116" seats 10–12.
Brand
dk3
General Dimensions

title: Muecke Dining Table
description:
From multifaceted practitioner Jonathan Muecke for Knoll, the all-wood Muecke Dining Table (2024) reimagines a classic form through material authenticity. Emphasizing wood's natural grain and distinct architectural joinery – the upshot to an extensive series of hand-built prototypes – Muecke creates generous objects that reveal their essential nature. Cylindrical dowels and exposed end grain transform the familiar into a study of simplicity, warmth, and fundamental design principles. Made in Poland.
  • A classic form reimagined through the material authenticity of wood.
  • Cylindrical dowels and exposed end grain transform the familiar into a study of simplicity.
  • The first commercial collection between the multifaceted practicioner Jonathan Muecke and Knoll.
Brand
Knoll®
Collection
Muecke Collection
